name: Chronic Regional Pain Syndrome Type I
chief_complaint: I have constant burning pain in my right hand that won't go away, and it's swollen and sensitive to touch.
prognosis: Variable; early treatment improves outcomes but condition may become chronic in some cases
description: A chronic pain condition typically affecting one limb, often developing after an injury, surgery, stroke or heart attack. Characterized by prolonged or excessive pain and changes in skin color, temperature, and/or swelling in the affected area.
